claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

supporting_snippets.quote: Flublok [Inﬂuenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three inﬂuenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains puriﬁed HA proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived from Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frugiperda (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butter ies, and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- deﬁned lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further puriﬁed by column chromatography.
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote directly describes the production platform for Flublok, stating that recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells (Sf9 cells) using a baculovirus vector, which is the baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

supporting_snippets.quote: Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further puriﬁed by column chromatography.
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This segment specifically states that the hemagglutinin proteins are expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus vector, which is the core of the BEVS platform.

supporting_snippets.quote: Flublok contains no egg proteins, antibiotics, or preservatives. The single dose, preﬁlled syringes contain no natural rubber latex. Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculovirus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg).
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote provides supporting evidence that the production process involves baculovirus and insect cells (Spodoptera frugiperda), consistent with the BEVS platform.
